Articles.Content:
I just got Ubuntu 14.04, and I am wondering how to make KSP use 64-bit in the Target Line. I don't have it on Steam. Could someone give me the command for it? Or am I just stupid and there is 64 bit pre-installed?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-29T17:11:56Z" title="07/29/2015 05:11  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 29, 2015</time> by legoclone09**

Both 32-bit and 64-bit versions are installed for Linux.

The 32-bit binary is called KSP.x86.

The 64-bit binary is called KSP.x86\_64.

Simply run the one you want(\*). If you use a launcher or script you may need to adjust it accordingly.

[This thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24529) has a lot of good info, but beware some may be outdated.

(\*) You need a 64-bit version of Ubuntu to run the 64-bit version of KSP. Conversely, if you're on a 64-bit version of Linux and want to run the 32-bit version for some reason you need to install a whole pile of 32-bit compatibility libraries.
Ok, thank you! I just git Ubuntu 64 bit running!
